bibl.title: Letter from Blossom Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, November 14, 1952

div1.p: Blossom Reed thanks Hench for the photograph and clipping. She sends him rough copies of her invitation from the Cuban government to attend the Lazear Memorial, and of her reply declining to attend.

div1.head: Letter from Blossom Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, November 14, 1952
div1.p:
Nov- 14- 1952- MRS. BLOSSOM REED
BLUE RIDGE SUMMIT
PENNSYLVANIA
Dear Dr- Hench-

Please forgive
me for not writing
sooner. I thank you
for your last letter
and the picture &
clipping of Oct 3- I am
so proud of you and
all you do- Now
I am enclosing a
rough copy of my
invitation to Cuba &
Ac
Hms
my reply- Maybe
a little too red-blooded
but I don't see
why they think I
could be so stupid.
I shall pass out
if you don't approve-
I have been so
deep in sending over
seas packages &
housework and
yard work that
is why you have
MRS. BLOSSOM REED
BLUE RIGGE SUMMIT
PENNSYLVANIA
not heard from
me- I hope you
and your dear
family are well
and a very
Happy Thanksgiving
day to each of you-
With my love-

In the name of Dr-
Alberto Recio - etc- etc-
Building No. 1 of Lazear
Camp; where the work
proving the discovery of
Dr- Carlos Finlay I have the
honor to invite you
on the act of unveiling
the bust, Drs- Walter Reed
James Carroll, Jesse Lazear
etc etc---------
Said act will take
place 3rd Dec- 1000 A. M-
on the spot (I love that)
Lazear Camp- etc-
Ac
Hms
We ho-pe to have
the honor your
accompany us on
said ceremony-

Very Sincerely Yours
Ceasar Rodriguez Exposito

Thank you so very
much for the kind
invitation to come to Havana.
Cuba was a spot dear
to my beloved father's
heart- He held Dr. Carlos Finlay
in high esteem as he did
all of his yellow Fever
commission- Walter Reed
did not live to know
the wonderful tributes
paid him - as did my
dear mother - my Brother &
myself for his discovery
of yellow Fever. We have
been proud indeed through
Ac
Hms
the fifty years since
his passing - and we
too have been humble
as he taught us to be-
He wanted in his
sweet- gentle and
generous nature to
share his work
with all those around
him- I know he
would be pleased
about Dr- Finlay, and
his yellow Fever Colleagues.
I am honored at your
kind invitation. It is the
distance that keeps me
away- With re-newed
thanks, and my very
best wishes to Dr. Alberto Recio-
and your self-
